input_claim: Chinatown MRT is on the green line.

REASONING: Multiple official and reliable sources confirm that Chinatown MRT station is NOT on the green line. The Land Transport Authority (LTA) official website states that Chinatown MRT Station (NE4/DT19) is located on the North East Line and Downtown Line.

SBS Transit, the official operator of Chinatown station, confirms that Chinatown Station (NE4) operates on the North East (NE) Line with purple line branding and connects to Downtown Line (DT19) with blue line branding since 2013.

Multiple sources consistently confirm the Singapore MRT line color coding: East West Line is Green, North East Line is Purple, and Downtown Line is Blue. Chinatown station is on the Purple (North East) and Blue (Downtown) lines, not the Green (East West) line.

One suspicious website (lta-gov-sg.to) claims Chinatown has been moved to the green line, but this appears to be a fake/scam website with suspicious download links and countdown timers. The legitimate LTA website is lta.gov.sg, not lta-gov-sg.to.

All legitimate official sources (LTA.gov.sg, SBSTransit.com.sg) and reliable travel information sources consistently state that Chinatown MRT is on the North East Line (Purple) and Downtown Line (Blue), not the East West Line (Green).
